oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Amiens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Travel guidebook (in French) for sites and landmarks in Amiens, a city in northern France, that Hodge visited while abroad. Includes printed photos and prints of the cathedral, a hotel, a museum and other town buildings. There is a map on the back page of public transportation. 16 pages.
During the war, Amiens was one of the first battles that led to the Hundred Day Offensive, which ultimately ended the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Robert Frank Hodge World War I Papers, 1914-1919
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: American Field Service; World War, 1914-1918
Travel guidebooks
